website_summaries.verdict: This popular bottle warmer from a trusted brand heats milk and baby food evenly in just a few minutes.
pros: Compact design won't take up much counter space
Indicator light lets you know when it's turned on
cons: Some complain that it lacks a timer

customer_reviews.title: can adjust dial for various heat settings, also fits Comotomo bottles
customer_reviews.text: We love the dial (vs the on off button like w Munchkin and other brands) that Kiinde also has but Avent is less pricey. I turn it up all the way to quickly heat a bottle or I turn it on low to keep the bottle in there for a while. We switched to Comotomo bottles and the CT bottles fit in the Avent warmer.
customer_reviews.author: Papuga

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly fast and can thaw frozen milk!
customer_reviews.text: The fastest, best bottle warmer I HAVE EVER HAD! Frozen bags of milk? Yep you can thaw them in about 10 minutes on highest setting OR WARM A BOTTLE IN 2.5 MINUTED FLAT. This is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Camden

customer_reviews.title: Biggest problem is it doesn't have a timer and doesn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Biggest problem is it doesn't have a timer and doesn't shut automatically. I have to set timer on my phone or look at the clock every minute. When I use this at middle of the night, I fall asleep and this thing is on until I wake up.
customer_reviews.author: Iris

customer_reviews.title: A must have for any newborn parent!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this warmer! Got this for my daughter & son-in-law. They've been using a pot of water, waiting for it to heat up then setting the bottle in it, waiting for that to warm up - in the meantime you can imaging how upset that may make an impatient infant! Not fun. This warmer is fantastic. From fridge cold, it has warmed 3 to 4 oz bottles to perfect temps within 2-3 mins. About the time it takes a -now practiced- mom (or dad!) to clean a very dirty bottom & replace clothing. PERFECT!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Mather

customer_reviews.title: Mandatory accessory working well
customer_reviews.text: This one is a mandatory accessory you need at home when you are bottle-feeding your baby. Works well and fast but the timelines mentioned in the manual are far too stretched. I usually try to heat up 60ml of milk and it takes just under a minute for this warmer to warm it up. However, using this warmer is like a learning curve, you would have to use it several times to understand it. Works well for now !!
customer_reviews.author: Jayakrishna Tiramdasu

customer_reviews.title: Not "fast"
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, this warmer is not fast, not even close. We had a different style warmer that was used and finally gave out so we bought this as a replacement. The old one warmed a bottle in under 3 minutes. This warmer takes 7 minutes to do the same thing and you can't leave the bottle in the warmer while you finish a task or it will overheat. There's not an alarm or anything when the bottle is done either, you have to use your own judgment. NOT a busy mom friendly product.
customer_reviews.author: vk10

customer_reviews.title: We use this for breast milk and it works great! It's an even warmth and is warm in ...
customer_reviews.text: We use this for breast milk and it works great! It's an even warmth and is warm in just a few minutes. **I have not used it to defrost** I always thaw my milk in the fridge then warm it when the boy is ready to eat. It is recommended to not microwave breast milk which Is why we got this, and I do like it! I also like the keep warm feature it has because sometimes hubby warms a bottle thinking theta what the baby wants and it's not so he keeps it warm until it is what he wants. It works great! Just follow the directions and it is fine.
customer_reviews.author: J&M T

customer_reviews.title: Not really useful since doesn't turn off automatically
customer_reviews.text: Thinking about probably the 2 most must-have features that a bottle warmer should have, this one has only 1: Heats up really quick, however the (for me) most important one is really unpleasant to manage since you have to pay attention really badly to turn it off, otherwise it will overheat the milk (and that can happen really easy with this one since it warms up real quick as already said). Hence really dislike this item (bought it because of the great reviews). Also, the water system (open system) is not really my favorite because while holding your baby anything can happen and you could spill it out easily.
customer_reviews.author: Mª Carmen

customer_reviews.title: Like other reviewers have mentioned
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers have mentioned, I really wish this had a timer. We are using for the Como Tomo bottle and find you have to leave it in much longer than recommended for the Avent bottles. Lastly, we feel there is a typo in the main table which indicates how much time. For small bottle size, the time increases as the ounces increase but then decreases for 4-5 ounces. That doesn't seem right. Overall I think the main table which indicates how much time is not clear
customer_reviews.author: John Rolston

customer_reviews.title: Obviously someone without a kid designed this dumb device.
customer_reviews.text: Company like Philips couldn’t add simple timer or just a shut off function to their bottle warmer. I wake up 2am start a bottle, go change diaper. By time I get back to kitchen bottle scolding hot. I mean really give me a break. I barely sleep ever since had our beautiful angel. How the hell my supposed to time a bottle warmer when I can barely navigate room to kitchen. I think I very disappointed because I always had higher expectations from philips products.
customer_reviews.author: EA

customer_reviews.title: Warms bottles in 4 min. A+
customer_reviews.text: Warms up bottles in about 3-4 min for 2-4 oz. We bought this since we had Avent bottles. You could really use any bottles probably as the opening is fairly wide. I recommend this warmer. It doesn't have auto shutoff or timer which is the only drawback. For the price though this compared well.
customer_reviews.author: C. McCranie

customer_reviews.title: In fact it’s so much easier than stove top and I can do it at work so no wasted milk. For regular warming it’s also awesome because ...
customer_reviews.text: This does not have an automatic shut off which is why I got it. I have high lipase in my breast milk so I have to bring it to a boil (165-185 degrees) which I can do with no problems in this. In fact it’s so much easier than stove top and I can do it at work so no wasted milk. For regular warming it’s also awesome because it takes just a few minutes to warm milk for baby. It also has a cooling function so if you need to keep the milk cold you can.
customer_reviews.author: JTanner

customer_reviews.title: Fast, consistent heat for bottle!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bottle warmer. Our first bottle warmer (different brand) broke after less than 2 months. I was hesitant to purchase this one because it didn’t have a timer on it and it doesn’t turn off automatically. There is plenty of wiggle room with heating options though. If you think you’ll be busy, you can choose to heat the bottle more slowly or just keep the bottle warm if baby isn’t quite ready. If baby is hungry, you can turn it up all the way and have a bottle ready in just a couple of minutes. This warmer is much nicer than my previous purchase and I wish I would have purchased this one first!
customer_reviews.author: W. Krause

customer_reviews.title: Warm water works faster
customer_reviews.text: It probably works well with glass bottles only. It takes 4.5 minutes to warm a 3-5oz bottle, not 3 as advertised. It takes about 7 minutes to warm 5-9 oz bottles so I can only imagine how long it takes to warm 9-11 oz bottles. I only use Avent bottles. Breastmilk warms in a freezer bag under warm water faster than it would in this. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Swms

customer_reviews.title: So much better than hot water!
customer_reviews.text: I debated buying a bottle warmer and so glad I ended up with one! We were heating bottles 'the old fashion way' by running under hot water and submersion. This is soo much more convenient, faster, and probably will save us the price of the device in water usage in just the first month! However, I really wish it had an automatic off feature as you have to 'babysit' and ensure you take the bottle out in x time. Considering it has different options for heating, I would think it could have automatic off based on those settings. Even without the feature, we are very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Hurst

customer_reviews.title: Could be improved in so many ways, but gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: PROS: -Found this this bottle warmer fits MOST bottles, and frozen breastmilk bags -Ultimately warms up milk or formula to desired temperature -Simple design that doesn't take up much counter space CONS -There is a ton of settings you can use, but really none of them make that much sense. The device could be simplified to a basic on/off switch -Doesn't have an auto-off feature, and when you are dealing with a baby who wants his bottle 5 minutes ago a forgetful parent/caregiver can forget to turn off the appliance -Seems to take a solid 5-6+ minutes to warm up a bottle
customer_reviews.author: lulup33

customer_reviews.title: Must have!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok ok ok...so everyone says that a bottle warmer is unnecessary. And I was struggling for 2 months trying to warm up my bottles while my baby is hungry and crying in the middle of the night. I only wish I ordered this sooner!!!! Instead of warming up a bottle in water for 10 or more minutes, I warm up a bottle in roughly 2-3 minutes. Mothers know exactly how much those 7 waisted minutes mean with a little babe. It saves time and frustration. Yes, you do have to manually turn it off but I already got into a habit of it so I'm ok.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a good option
customer_reviews.text: Don’t do it! This is not the bottle warmer you want. There is no timer, so you’re just guessing or using your phone. There is no automatic off, so if you’re half asleep and forget to turn it off, you’re left with boiling water. Once the water boils off, it’s left to melt. It’s a terrible design for parents. Apparently the designer has never had kids because nobody in their right mind would make such an cruel product for someone who is so sleep deprived.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Piper

customer_reviews.title: Clean it each time you use it if you don't want food poisoning on your hands and bottles
customer_reviews.text: We got super sick after using this for awhile. I was cleaning it but not every single time. Now I clean it EVERY TIME! It is very cheap and simple to use. Hasn't burned out after 11 month so that's good, but it gets nasty really fast and that bacteria will be on your hands from the water the bottle touched and the dial on the device... It doesn't heat consistently so it can be hard to tell when a bottle is done
customer_reviews.author: E. Earley

customer_reviews.title: I was gonna return it...
customer_reviews.text: It's okay but could be lot better. I had baby brezza which got soaked and got this as a replacement and this is a such downgrade. Baby brezza was on backorder and needed something quick and this is just not the same. Yes it warm up the bottle but no timer no alert. 2 in the morning your eyes are half closed and figure out it's been 4 mins is not a easy thing to do. If you dont get it out in time it get over heated. Because the device doesn't have any sort of sensor. I would not recommend but get it if you have no other choice.
customer_reviews.author: Stevelyn

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I hate this this product. It’s not reliable, it’s not accurate, it’s not easy to use, and it’s impssoble to get the milk the right temperature. I’ve read and re-read the instructions, watched videos, and when I do exactly as directed it’s too cold. Then! I keep it in like just a little longer (30 seconds, maybe a minute) and it’s way too hot. It’s not a bottle warmer, it’s water warmer that makes it so you have to guess the exact second (which changes with each time) it gets to the recommended ~98 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: kdizz

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: If you're like me and ONLY buy after reading great reviews about a product, then read my review and simply press the buy button! (I buy from Amazon at least once a week!) Honestly, this product was just as described and very cute packaging. It shipped really fast too. I look for quality when buying anything and this met my standards 100%. I'm not too big on writing reviews all the time but I took the time out to do so because I'm very please with this purchase. I would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Nellygal45

customer_reviews.title: Worst instruction manual ever!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve seen some bad manuals in my time but this was by far the worst. It literally does not tell you what each setting does. Unlike most bottle warmers, this has multiple settings on the dial. One would think that the manual would have a clear description of what each setting does. It does not. I told my wife “this has to be returned” and she said that it can’t be that bad. After 15 minutes with the manual, she threw up her hands and got out the packing tape. There’s no way the good reviews on this project can be legit.
customer_reviews.author: DLosangeles

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Favorite bottle warmer. Purchased this warmer for warming our daughters bottles. I am an infant teacher so I have gone through many bottle warmers over the last 10 years and this is by far the best. I loved it so much in the classroom that I bought one for the house to use for our baby. The other bottle warmers get so dirty and brown on the inside and stink and this one never has had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Mock

customer_reviews.title: Pointless.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t be fooled by the “best product rated by moms” crap sticker this product has. This is the most pointless bottle warmer ever. There is no timer. Meaning you have to fill it with water with every individual bottle warming and just freaking guess when it’s done or set a separate timer which is so much fun to do one handed at 2am with your newborn. You may as well run each bottle under hot water every time you need one. I’m so mad I ever bought this. My husband and I are now looking for a new bottle warmer and pissed we didn’t keep the box so we could return this.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Get this!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has one of these bottle warmers and always brings it with her when she visits, which is often. One weekend she forgot to bring it and I missed it so much that I ordered one to have at my house permanently. I always seem to have grand babies coming and going and I absolutely love this product! It is easy to use and heats the bottle really fast. Much better than using a microwave or waiting for the bottle to heat up under hot water. You will not be disappointed if purchasing this item!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality and Function! Buy This!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t think buying a bottle warmer would be so hard to select but it was. The expensive or tech-y cool looking ones seemed to have issues with mold/gunk which freaked me out, and the cheaper ones seemed to risk getting too hot. I held my breath and bought this one and we are SO happy with it. Love the different heating settings and bottle heats so evenly and gently but FAST! Read the care and heating instructions and you’ll be good. As others have said, only thing for an improvement would love an auto shut off feature. Would definitely pay more for that if the overall quality stayed the same.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: It is unclear if the instructions are plain wrong or if the warmer I got is defective but so far I have not managed to salfely warm a single bottle to the desired temp. The water added get warm but the bottle and contents do not. It says that a small bottle needs 3 minutes but even after 5 it was still cold. I don’t want to damage the milk so I don’t leave it for longer than that. Sadly just stopped using it as it doesn’t work. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: NaTalie

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: It works, but it is not ideal. Though there are varying settings (defrost, warm, and different levels of heat all ranged on a dial), there is no automatic shut off nor is there a timer option, which is my biggest issue with it aside from timing. As a parent, especially in the early months like I'm in right now, if you get distracted or walk away from the warmer too long you can easily overheat the milk and risk having to make your crying child wait longer so it cools down and also destroying nutrients in breast milk. The other issue is simply timing. There's no way to measure how long it takes to get to an ideal temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Shavlik

customer_reviews.title: No timer. Be cautious
customer_reviews.text: I originally got this product to try to use in my car. Well that didn’t work but then I thought I would try to use it at home. As others have stated, there is no timer on this. You have to keep a watch over it and check the temp every so often. It did take longer than expected to heat just two ounces in it, although the time wasn’t terribly long. This is an ok buy if you’re wanting to watch it like a hawk but I preferred my other one that I hit the button and it shuts off after so long. The timer is everything. And this one takes way more water than my other warmer
customer_reviews.author: Mtoddnp

customer_reviews.title: So much more convenient than using the stove to boil ...
customer_reviews.text: So much more convenient than using the stove to boil water or running the hot water from the sink! Hope it last me a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Not good for impatient babies
customer_reviews.text: If you have an impatient baby who doesn't want to wait five minutes for his warm milk at 3am, this is not for you. The worse buy we made for baby. My baby screams like a banshee when he doesn't get his milk right away so I have no time to go through that chart to see how long I should leave 3 ounces in for. Do yourself a favor and just get a hot water machine that already has the water prepared.
customer_reviews.author: H. Tran

customer_reviews.title: Great for scalding breast milk for high lipase!
customer_reviews.text: Great bottle warmer for scalding milk if you have high lipase! I purchased this specifically for that purpose - it took about 8 minutes to scald 6 oz of breast milk to 180 degrees. It took less than 4 minutes for the milk to reach body temp from about 45 degrees. I know a lot of reviewers complained that it doesn’t have an auto-shut off, but that’s definitely what you need to get temps high enough to deactivate lipase. I can see how this would be a pain in the butt for normal daily heating. It would be nice if it had a digital temp reading built in too, but I just used a regular kitchen thermometer instead.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Hendrickson

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent - don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this bottle warmer. It is inconsistent. I warm the same quantity of milk, at the same setting, with the same amount of water in the warmer, for the same amount of time, and sometimes it is cold and sometimes it is scorching hot. Have had to dump a lot of milk due to the unpredictable performance of this warmer.
customer_reviews.author: Merlin_Celt

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a replacement for the bottle warmer we have had for a while now. Thankfully, after this piece of crap arrived, my husband was able to descale the old one so we can still use it. This "bottle warmer" takes forever to get anywhere near a decent temperature but be careful, sometimes it makes the bottle WAY too hot. You really never know what temp you're going to get.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Donahue-Hoogerhyde

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: The bottle warmer is very easy to use, but it is also very easy to over heat things bc there isnt a automatic shut off or timer. You have to keep checking it to make sure it's not too hot in the beginning. But if you are looking for a basice get your bottles warm thing then this is it. It is good for different bottles not just Philips. I think it can even thaw baby food. I havent tried that feature yet but it's good to have. As for cleaning... it's some what difficult if something gets into the water bc you cant take anything apart to get under the vent. But all in all a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amber B.

customer_reviews.title: Good warmer, if you just ignore all the settings
customer_reviews.text: I really like this warmer, but I had to learn to ignore all those settings and options it has. It’s best to just crank it up to the highest one and let the bottle said in it for about two minutes... If you choose one of the lower settings even though it might be indicated as the right one you’ll end up sitting there waiting on the bottle 4five minutes or so... Which doesn’t fly when a baby is screaming because they are hungry.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for neti pot warming (squeeze bottle type)
customer_reviews.text: On instructions from my allergist, I use a squeeze-bottle type nasal rinse (neti pot), which has to be filled with distilled water. (Allergist said that there are things in tap water that can’t be removed by boiling, although he did not specifically say “brain-eating amoebae.”). All well and good during warm summer weather, but in winter, it’s a recipe for brain freeze. Enter the Philips AVENT. Five minutes in this baby, and your eight-ounce bottle of highly scientific salt water is at the perfect temperature to whoosh through your poor, plugged-up sinuses in maximum comfort. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Agrippina Frogbottom

customer_reviews.title: One big design flaw
customer_reviews.text: While this product is relatively inexpensive and fairly easy to use, there's one big design flaw: There is no auto-off feature, built in timer, or alarm. Products like bottle warmers are supposed to help, not hinder. Having to manually time the formula while it heats can be next to impossible while simultaneously taking care of a newborn. Since the warmer provides a continuous heat source, formula can easily overheat if you get pulled away; honestly you're better off just sticking the bottle in a warm cup of water to heat. Being such a big-named brand, I'm surprised this feature was overlooked. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: I recommend it
customer_reviews.text: I love how it has different temperatures for formula you want to put the temperature in the middle it will keep it warm if you go any higher than the middle it will get super hot you don't want that unless your water super cold for the formula. It also warms up baby food I recommend a lower temperature for the baby food.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Jusino

customer_reviews.title: Really good warmer
customer_reviews.text: Previously had the Tommee Tippee warmer, but that broke after eight months of use. The unit would not shut off; just continued to heat until the water boiled. This warmer has an equally wide opening for large bottles, but the water does not seem to evaporate as fast. You'll still need to add a little water a couple times per day, assuming 5+ uses. For a 6oz bottle that starts at 40 degrees from the fridge, it takes about 7 minutes to get it lukewarm.
customer_reviews.author: ZRreviews

customer_reviews.title: Great...but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: The Philips Avent Fast Bottle Warmer definitely lives up to its title. It warms a bottle right out of the fridge up to body temperature within 4-6 minutes and my baby takes the bottle right away. The warmer is also easy enough for almost anyone to figure out and use. The only con is that there is no timer on the warmer itself or a auto shut-off. You have to set a timer yourself and remember to turn the warmer off after the bottle has been taken out.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Houston

customer_reviews.title: Works great! I have glass bottles I use it for ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I have glass bottles I use it for and this one warms them up perfectly. The warmer day care uses broke my glass botlle cause it heated up to fast so I bought them one of these and no problems. I also now heat my sons frozen food up in a glass bottle and it thaws the cubes out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The unit itself heats up fast (maybe 30 seconds) and bottles are ready very quickly - a must have for those middle of the night feeds. Cleaning the unit is easy. I just hold it sideways in the sink and use the sprayer hose. All the water and accumulated lint and dust washes right out. We have had the unit for a out 3 weeks and no complaints so far. We have not used the defrost setting yet.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Left on LOW 24/7 for the last 10 mos...
customer_reviews.text: I've left this warmer on Low 24/7 for the last 10 mos with a bottle of distilled water in it and it's performed flawlessly. When the baby is hungry, the water is already at the ideal temp, and you need only add the formula. Fortunately, our little weeble-wobble finishes her bottles 95% of the time, so reheating a cold bottle doesn't happen too often, but even when we need to, it doesn't take but a few minutes when you set it to Hi. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: J. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Gets the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: We like this bottle warmer, but more than that, we like having a bottle warmer. It was one of those baby products we weren't sure about getting since warming bottles can be done with other methods like sitting out or running under hot water. Our son takes a bottle at least once a day and I am very happy to not have to use those other methods, thanks to having a bottle warmer. This warmer in particular is fine. It's easy to use and it heats our bottles well. While having a timer would be nice, we just set a timer on the microwave. We use Philips Avent bottles so they fit nicely in the warmer.
customer_reviews.author: jjschmitt

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't want to warm bottles without it.
customer_reviews.text: This. Thing. Is. Awesome! SUPER convenient. SUPER easy to use. Make sure there's water in it, and just turn the dial to start warming. A 4oz bottle straight from the refrigerator takes less than 4 mins to warm. No hot spots, nice even warming! No stove, no microwave, no hassle!! We keep this on top of a mini-fridge near our room for quick overnight feeds and it's been INCREDIBLE! Already purchased one for another friend with a newborn!
customer_reviews.author: James L.

customer_reviews.title: Blah
customer_reviews.text: Does the job but no light no sounds nothing will let you know the milk is ready. You have stand next to it or set a timer on your phone. Horrible. If you use formula i would recommend heating up the water in a small pot really quick, it will take less time than using this and trying to guess if it’s hot enough. If you use breast milk it’s ok because it requires less guessing knowing the breastmilk was already warm or room temperature
customer_reviews.author: Jesica Blaise

customer_reviews.title: MAMA YOU NEED DIS IN YO LYFE
customer_reviews.text: I've only tried one other brand besides this one but this one takes the cake for sure for a warmer under $20. The "keep warm" is great because my son is a very weird eater and will eat a little, stop for a little, eat a little, stop for a little and so on. So it's great for keeping his bottle warm while he takes his breaks. Plus it hasn't gotten all nasty smelling and gross like the my old warmer did.
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: Still using it & works for what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I feel like it's fading out in usage because it used to heat up a lot quicker (30 weeks later) but hey I'm still using it and it gets the job done so it's worth the buy. It's just the water evaporating that's annoying so I keep a cup of water nearby and the overflowing when the bottle is in is annoying too. Can fit any bottle so do what you need to do to get by and survive those first 3 months!
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Philips avent bottle warmer
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a nice thing to have for warming milk but does take a little to get used to. There is no timer so the milk can and will get beyond any drinkable temperature if left too long. We’ve found setting the warmer to straight vertical (notch pointing up to the light) is perfect for maintaining drinkable warm milk. It does seem to build up scale under the basket and is very difficult to scrub clean with a brush. Philips says to use a water/vinegar mix to descale but we haven’t tried it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Great warmer- wish there was an auto shutoff feature.
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It is super easy to use however I do have 2 of them and one does warm up quicker and hotter than the other. Other than that the warm cycles are consistent every time. I do wish there was an auto shut off feature because I always forget to turn it off during night time feedings. The water will boil out if you leave it on so it is kinda scary if you forget to turn it off because it will continue to heat even after the water has evaporated.
customer_reviews.author: Eva

customer_reviews.title: Overall very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I got this as it is the most popular baby bottle warmer. However, I'm quite disappointed. While it has very good build quality, there are several problems which prevent it from become a good bottle warmer. 1. No timer / automatic control. It won't tell you that the warm process finished. You need to calculate the time used for warm and monitoring it yourself. Or else you'll just get a over heated or under heated milk. You could use keep warm setting but you'll need to wait for 20 mins (which is not usable if you have a crying baby). 2. The warmer is very slippery and hard to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Teddy Z.

customer_reviews.title: Good, basic bottle warmer
customer_reviews.text: I got this warmer largely because I bought Avent's glass bottles and didn't want to risk issues with breaking or size using a different brand of warmer. I had their old model of bottle warmer with a previous child and honestly this one is similar, very simple. It claims that you can use it for baby food but my 4 oz. bottles are close to the same height as the rim when they're in the warmer so I'm not sure exactly how that would work, but I also don't really plan on using it for that feature. All in all I'm content with the warmer, but it is nothing fancy.
customer_reviews.author: ksparkles

customer_reviews.title: It's okay...
customer_reviews.text: This bottle warmer is ok. Easy to use, clearly marked dial, etc. but it doesn't heat the bottle very fast at all. The recommended time of 3 minutes does not heat a refrigerated 3oz bottle, even 5 minutes doesn't really heat it well. I'm assuming the "recommended time" is for tap water temp bottles? I don't know, but hearing your breast milk from the fridge you will find 5 minutes waiting on this warmer is the longest 5 minutes of your life when your baby is hungry.
customer_reviews.author: Heather H

customer_reviews.title: Simple, easy to use, streamlined design
customer_reviews.text: I love the simplicity of this bottle warmer. Just a dial front and open top. Fits tommee tippee 5oz. bottles perfectly. The time to warm is a little vague in the instructions but once I honed in on the perfect temp it was super easy, I found that approximately 1 minute per ounce was our sweet spot. I used tap water in mine and it did get some hard water buildup, but a good cleaning and switching to distilled and the issue was resolved. I do have to refill/add water to it about once a week.
customer_reviews.author: ERO_foto

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to use, and it does the job, but I wish it was a little more convenient. There's no timer feature, so you need to be vigilant about how long the bottle is in the warmer, and everyone knows how easy it can be to get distracted with a newborn. It's also kind of annoying to have to adjust the water level every bottle (we have a newborn who eats inconsistent amounts right now). Like I said, it does the job, but it could be better!
customer_reviews.author: TTank9288

customer_reviews.title: Nice warmer.. BUT!
customer_reviews.text: No timer. Like.. What a duh feature to have right? And this has none. Also, nothing to hold the bottle down. You have to keep pouring water out and in to adjust level so that the bottle doesn't float. This happens when heating diffent amounts of milk. Other than these quirks and lack of features, it does what it's supposed to... Albeit with some fidgeting and worrying that you left the milk in there for enough time or too little time!
customer_reviews.author: Simon Belmont

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, no issues so far
customer_reviews.text: *I got this as a massage oil warmer* and it works perfectly! Absolutely love how easy it is to use out of the box, and it cleans super easily. The temperature control only got 4 stars cause it can get a bit hot if you add too much water, but I was using a glass bottle in it so that may have contributed to the temp. If your using it to warm milk in baby bottles I’d recommend testing your bottle with water first to see how high you need to fill the warmer so you don’t scorch your liquid gold!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay.
customer_reviews.text: My wife uses the Glass bottles. This little thing is great I just wish it had a self timer to turn off on its own. Overall it’s pretty good just feel for the price the knob should have a more advance setting like their baby bottle washer. We use it to keep bottles warm. Don’t let the setting fool you it’s basically warm, hot and super hot. We’ve learned to keep it at warm and have a bottle ready for baby when he’s hungry. I wouldn’t buy again but I also am not upset I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Great for pumping mamas!
customer_reviews.text: This bottle warmer is perfect for mamas who pump breastmilk and want it safely and quickly warmed up! Sits on our counter top in my pumping station where I keep all my cleaned pumping pieces. It thaws and warms frozen breastmilk in minutes, fits the wide and sticky Tommy Tippee or Munchkin Latch bottled and the skinnier glass evenflow bottles. Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: HShelton

customer_reviews.title: Great for all bottles and then some
customer_reviews.text: Breastfed baby here, use this all the time! I pump and freeze my milk. This does a great job of defrosting milk, heating up baby cereal in a baby bowl, and everything in-between. Have Dr. Brown bottles, Medela, Nuk, and Avent.
customer_reviews.author: Chyna

customer_reviews.title: Lacks Key Features
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this as I really love the Avent bottles. Unfortunately, I can’t love it because it’s a huge downside that it doesn’t have a timer & an auto shut off. It would help tremendously if it would reach the desired temperature & then keep it at that temp and not continue to get hotter and hotter. No internal timer makes it trickier to prepare bottles for baby. Expected more from such a well known, highly esteemed company. On the plus side, it’s extremely easy to set up straight out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Herres

customer_reviews.title: tripping the circuit breaker
customer_reviews.text: While I have no issue with the functionalities of this product, I am not happy with its reliability. For some reason, this product keeps tripping my breaker. I've moved it to 3 different places and plugged into 3 different outlet, all 3 of them got tripped. It didn't happen immediately but it did eventually.
customer_reviews.author: S. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Not automatic! Not as fast as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: While this is very easy to clean and compact and looks nice on your countertop, I was disappointed in the fact that I have to manually time the bottle warmer. Also it advertises that it heats most bottles in 3 minutes. This is not actually true. According to the time chart cold milk from the refrigerator takes 3 and 1/2 minutes to 5 1/2 minutes on average. I wish there was a timer function built in. It would also be nice to have an automatic off in case you forget to turn it off in your sleepless haze with a newborn!
customer_reviews.author: MLM

customer_reviews.title: Gets the Job done
customer_reviews.text: We like the bottle warmer. I got it because we use Comotomo bottles and they fit in this one. I would disagree that it only takes 3 minutes to heat a bottle and we actually use the big bottle setting for all our bottles because it doesn't take as long. The milk defrost setting is weird. The manual says up to six hours... Takes 2-3 minutes to defrost in running hot water in the sink. However, it works and it is durable enough to through in a bag and take with you. Cleaning is a pain as there is a grate in the bottom but no way to remove and clean the heating plate underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Hathaway

customer_reviews.title: Product was probably fine but did not like that it did not have ...
customer_reviews.text: Product was probably fine but did not like that it did not have a timer! Does not specify on the product how the warmer really works until you open it. Thought that's what the dial was for but it's not. It stays on all the time unless you turn the dial off. I like the Kiinde warmer as the timer and the power are the same... when you turn the dial to the time you want, it also heats and when the time stops the warmer stops.
customer_reviews.author: Bear307

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would hate this warmer when I first opened it. I wish it had a timer to shut off, but it doesn’t, so you just have to keep an eye on it and remember it’s in there. For 2-3 oz in the small setting it takes about 6 min to get warm. You can jack it up to the highest setting for more or frozen milk and it obviously heats it quicker. When baby is screaming and hungry I wish it was faster, but we just turn it to a higher setting.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, functional, just needs an auto-shutoff!
customer_reviews.text: Like many other reviewer say. It warms quickly It has multiple useful heat temperatures It doesn't have an auto-shutoff or true tempreature gauge so you really gotta remember to shut it off!. If it had a shutoff, it would be 5 stars. For the price considering the competition, this was exactly what we needed at a way cheaper pricepoint than some of the others.
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: Best one yet
customer_reviews.text: At first i disliked this warmer because there is no auto shutoff and bottle can become boiling hot. After buying three other brands, this is the best warmer, it gets hot quickly, nice when baby is waiting. Easy to clean too. I have dr browns, it was nice for a bit then became a pain in the ass and smelled. I have tommy one, takes forever i mean forever to warm a bottle. I use como tomo bottles, and dr browns.
customer_reviews.author: JBH

customer_reviews.title: Easy and convenient to use but wish there was a timer.
customer_reviews.text: Only reason I don't give this 5 stars is because i feel like its missing a timer. I usually start warming the bottle just before I change my baby's diaper so when I'm done, its warm. There have been a few times where I ran into some unexpected difficulties during a diaper change and it took a little longer than expected so when I got to the bottle, it was too hot. If there as some sort of timer to shut it off or to switch to "keep warm" after a couple minutes, it would be PERFECT. But considering this is on a lower end price for what it is, I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simplify warming bottles...
customer_reviews.text: This bottle warmer does a good job doing exactly what you need it to. Without repeating what all of the other reviews say, bottom line is it works really well. The only complaint I have with it is it doesn't really have a temperature control that I can speak to considering the amount of breast milk that's in a bottle. It takes between 30 seconds and 3 minutes to warm a bottle, depending on whether the milk is frozen and the amount of milk to be heated.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: This warmer is doing its job!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is doing its job. I read that some reviewers had problem with switch off not working properly - in my case everything is working great. It does not have a timer so you need to keep an eye on a bottle because it'll make it hot (it's perfect for frozen breast milk). Also i saw few reviews where people did not know that they have to put water in......which messed up this bottle warmer. Instructions are right on the box, so make sure to read it.
customer_reviews.author: UnicornLife

customer_reviews.title: Depends on what you use it for , but I like mine enough to keep it
customer_reviews.text: Warms up water fast and fits large bottles inside the warmer which is great. Wish there was a timing setting to prevent overheating but overall it's a great product. Just keep an eye on the bottle temp!! I like it best to defrost frozen milk on the "keep warm" setting. Honestly though you could just keep a pan of boiling water on stove and heat / reheat the water as necessary and save the $. But I like it and use it, not perfect but works
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s durable, afforadable and best out there. But be careful that it can fail too
customer_reviews.text: I use this product to warm up formula bottles for baby. Honestly I really liked this product until it failed on me. I keep this bottle warmer on all day at low setting and keep a bottle with water so that when baby is ready to drink formula, I just take the warm bottle and add formula. One day this bottle warmer started heating up and boil water even at low setting. After like 5 month of use. So you have to be careful. Luckily it was day time so I noticed it but what if it was night and then I wouldn’t have tripped my electricity.
customer_reviews.author: Jasbir Kaur

customer_reviews.title: It’s fine.
customer_reviews.text: So, this fits most bottles and does a fast job of warming. However, the lack of timer and auto-off is pretty significant. I’m really surprised to find that there’s really not just a go-to fabulous bottle warmer out there. They all seem to have their pros and cons. But, this does that job as long as you’re willing to set a timer and only start it when you know you won’t be interrupted
customer_reviews.author: K. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: No timer. Not user friendly.
customer_reviews.text: The knobs were still confusing to me as the pictures aren't super clear. Even after reading instructions I was still slightly confused. As a new mom I need as simple and easy as possible and this is not. I didn't like that it didn't have a timer. I was constantly forgetting about it. And even when I would turn it off after the suggested 3 minutes the milk was still ice cold.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren McLeroy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!!
customer_reviews.text: It only takes 2 min to warm up a bottle of fridge breast milk! It doesn’t have a timer heads up! So you have to keep an eye on it! Once u turn it on it starts to heat up you but the bottle time it for 2 min and take it out and turn it off . It has a setting for baby food as well and one to keep bottles warm until you need them. Oh and also one for frozen milk! It does it’s job. I keep mine by the bed super helpful. Def recomendable it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lorena Mojarro

customer_reviews.title: Hot plate and a basket. Nothing special.
customer_reviews.text: It advertises that it circulates the milk to heat evenly. This is a bald faced lie. If you already own a coffee maker, run it without grounds, pour the hot water in a glass, and swirl the bottle while it heats for the same effect without an extra appliance. Waste of money. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Healy

customer_reviews.title: Not so good ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is not so good! It takes a drastically longer amount of time to heat a bottle of 2 oz than suggested (almost 4 minutes if they were in the fridge). The temperature controls are a bit problematic, should have warm, low, medium and high ... not almost incoherent pictures that you need to pull a manual out to translate (we are not all Egyptology that decipher hieroglyphics)! If you are in need of a reliable product look somewhere else!
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.

customer_reviews.title: It's okay. But maybe do your research before settling in buying this product.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for 6 months now. Every once in a while it just completely stops working. Then we'll try it in an hour and it works again. Cleaning it is a hassle too. I literally have to get a cotton swab to clean the inside. Besides those things, it does it's job. Milk gets warm in a timely fashion. This is the only bottle warmer I've used so I have nothing else to compare it to. But I wouldn't give this a complete thumbs up for other people to buy - just cuz of all the problems we've had with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rena Shikuma

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good except for one thing
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good except for one major thing. The one thing I do not like about this warmer is that it does NOT turn it self off after X amount of time. This is problematic when half awake/asleep and making a bottle in the middle of the night. Going to look into hooking it up to smart outlet so I can create a "make a bottle" plan that will turn the warmer on and turn off after 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Chucktastic

customer_reviews.title: Time saver
customer_reviews.text: This warmer has improved our life greatly from the good ol days of heat milk over the stove top. I was originally under the impression that this had a timer on it but it does not. You have to manually time your milk, which is okay, but it would be PERFECT if it just had a timer on it. Overall, this product has done wonders for how quickly the milk is heated and the overall consistency. I would buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley55

customer_reviews.title: Don’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: I really don’t understand why this item has Soooooo many good reviews. It took forever to warm up and it is easy to get it too hot.
customer_reviews.author: B.C

customer_reviews.title: fast and easy
customer_reviews.text: it takes forever for our tap water to get hot so this has been pretty awesome to have. i dont need the bottles to necessarily be warm but my son doesnt take them as well when the milk is cold out of the fridge. so i only need to put bottles in for a couple minutes to take the chill off. its perfect- i put the bottle in, change his diaper, and its good by the time thats done.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: takes to long to warm up
customer_reviews.text: bought this thinking it would help to get the babies bottle warm pretty quick, ended up taking a lot longer than expected. When you have a hungry baby you know time is important and this was not on my side. I ended up just putting a coffee mug with water in the microwave and setting the bottle in that when it was done in half the time.
customer_reviews.author: T0mmy Gunn

customer_reviews.title: Must have for bottle feeding
customer_reviews.text: As a new father, learning how to sooth at 3 in the morning was hard enough. Add carefully heating a bottle under hot water was simply too hard and wasteful of the water needed. Using this was as simple as putting the bottle in and turning the knob a few minutes before feeding. If you were late, there is a super speed setting as well.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Fossum

customer_reviews.title: Get a different bottle warmer than this
customer_reviews.text: I have had this now for three months. While it does heat the milk I do fill it takes longer than it says on the instructions. I also don’t like that it doesn’t have an automatic shut off or timer. I have to set the timer on my stove so I don’t forget about it. If I had to do it again I would get a different bottle warmer that has an automatic shut off timer. The instructions weren’t the greatest either. I had a hard time figuring out which setting to put it on. This is something I figured out myself. Overall, if I had to do it again I would get a different one
customer_reviews.author: nkell

customer_reviews.title: Pain in the butt, BUT...
customer_reviews.text: I knew going in this warmer did not have a timer however I did assume it would shut off (or turn back on) according to the temp of the bottle. Basically how a thermostat works. This is not the case. In fact in the directions it says to not leave bottle in warmer longer than stated time(s) or milk will overheat. Not cool!!! Pain in the butt, BUT for the price I guess you can’t go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Mekdeci

customer_reviews.title: Works well for warming massage oil
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to warm up massage oil. It worked well and it allowed to decrease and increase the temperature. I purchased 8 oz glass bottles and use them in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kate McKinney

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, a little slower than imagined.
customer_reviews.text: For a baby who likes to wait a couple minutes prior to eating once awakening during the nigh this would be perfect.. However, my baby loves to eat and it takes about 3 minutes to heat his bottle up. I have found going up and down our stairs is quicker to heat the water rather than waiting for this to heat up. It does the job but not quick enough for my little guy!
customer_reviews.author: Shania Lovelace

customer_reviews.title: Love it, except for one thing
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome small bottle warmer. It heats up 6 oz of room temp formula in 4 minutes with no thought to it. just plop it in, turn the knob the whole way and wait.... Here is where i took 1 star off, you need to time it yourself. There is no temp control, no timer, nothing that will prevent the bottle from getting too hot or alerting you that its time to check on it. Awesome otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Mukaking

customer_reviews.title: Great, but no auto turn off
customer_reviews.text: Great item for a good price. The only complaint I have is that you have to time how long the bottle is in the warmer yourself. It does not have a setting for automatic turn off or alert when bottle is ready. There have been a few times that I forgot about the bottle and ruined breast milk by overheating it. Wish it had an alarm or auto function where it kept the water at the same temperature after a certain time period.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisPrime

customer_reviews.title: Works Lotion Warmer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to warm up my child's lotion. She has eczema and extremely sensitive skin which made nightly application of lotion after bath a difficult process because the lotion was "too cold". I put about 3oz of the Cetaphil cream into the AVENT food jar, and right before bath, warm it up at the first setting for warming up a bottle of milk. In 5 min, lotion is at the right temperature and she no longer minds having lotion applied.
customer_reviews.author: BKMs

customer_reviews.title: Faster than warming bottle on the stove, no more boiling water in the middle of the night...
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, and you can’t beat the price. I thought the price was pretty reasonable. I keep it my room. When my baby starts to wake up in the AM for feeding, I turn on the warmer, throw the bottle in the, and by the time I change my baby’s diaper, the bottle is ready to go. No more trips to the kitchen to boil water to heat up bottles in the middle of the night. (sorry, I don’t like using microwave to heat my baby’s milk). I’m very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Laura R.

customer_reviews.title: You need a separate timer
customer_reviews.text: It’s actually a little frustrating using this if you want to heat a bottle and not overheat it. There’s not timer on it or anything. The instructions all have minutes of warm time on them, but you have to use a separate timer. There is a dial that does basically warm to hot and you set it and then set a timer to remind you to take it out. Works, but not super convenient to have to set a separate timer when some of these types of warmers hear just as well and have built in timers.
customer_reviews.author: MakiA

customer_reviews.title: Bottle warming is a breeze with this
customer_reviews.text: So easy tonise and pretty easy to clean. I wish it had an automatic shut off but if inset a timer it works great. I've used it with several different brands of bottles and it makes feedings a breeze. I set the bottle up to heat when she starts to get fussy and it's done before shes full blown crying. This thing is a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Very Simple
customer_reviews.text: I like that it's super simple. Just turn the nob and it heats. Tried to use my brother-in-laws with all kinds of settings that needed to be set and just used warm water in a bowl instead. There's nothing worse than a screaming infant and trying to figure out how to heat the damn bottle at 3am!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Herrmann

customer_reviews.title: clean with vinegar
customer_reviews.text: It definitely takes longer than the instructor suggest to heat a bottle. It works, but I've found myself giving my daughter a cool or room temp bottle just so she wouldn't have to keep waiting. She doesn't seem to mind. I saw some other reviews where people had an issue with milk build up.in the bottom of the warmer. I experienced this too; I just put some vinegar in it and turned it the warmer to high so that the vinegar boiled and that took the milk build up right off.
customer_reviews.author: MonkeyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Easy Peasy
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use and fast. Works with all sizes and shapes of bottles. We tried a lot of different bottles with our little one and this warmer did not fail us. Only wish is it had some sort of timer setting but if you keep an eye on it and don't forget you're heating up a bottle you should be fine. We also got a laser temperature gun which took all the guess work out of heating up bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Albe

product_meta.title: Philips Avent, Baby Bottle Warmer
product_meta.description: Philips AVENT SCF355/00 Bottle and Baby Food Warmer is a safe and easy way to make mealtime more comfortable for your baby. Once switched on, the warmer gently heats bottles and food within 3 minutes. Its compact size makes it easy to store on a kitchen countertop or bedside table for nighttime feedings. The warmer heats bottles and foods safely and evenly and unlike microwaves, won't cause hotspots, so you can be sure the internal temperature is safe for your baby. All Philips AVENT bottles, toddler cups, and food jars fit in the warmer. The warmer is fast and easy to operate - just plug in and flip the on/off switch on the back of the unit. A neon light lets you know the unit is on and working. An included instruction guide makes it easy to calculate the correct heat-up time. Operation involves adding water and turning the dial. A light blinks to indicate that the contents are properly warmed to a safe temperature. To be sure, always test the internal temperature before giving to babies.
feature_bullets: Gently and evenly heats no hotspots as the milk circulates during warming; The voltage is 220-240 V
Works with all Phillips Avent bottles, toddler cups, and most food jars
Heats 4 ounces of milk in 3 minutes
Convenient defrost setting that defrosts breast milk and baby food
Small design fits on counter or nightstand

specifications.Material Type: BPA Free, Phthalate Free, Latex Free, Lead Free
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars6,897 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
